description:
1. use viral genes to stop the virus reproducing. 
  
2. "phosphorodiamidate oligonucleotide"  is a chemical added to the blocks of DNA, and changes its genetic makeup of the virus and destroying it.  

3. Favipivavir drug - used in Japan to treat influenza. 

4. convalescent plasma – blood transfusions taken from survivors of Ebola, which are given to the victim in the hope that antibodies in the plasma will fight off the virus. 

5. hyperimmune globulin – used to treat rabies, tetanus and hepatitis B. The treatment is created by purifying and concentrating the plasma of immunised animals or previously infected humans. 

The problems we may face is that limited supplies, or causes of other dieases trying to treat this one.
summary: There are few solutions that MAY work, but there are also many cons and pros related to each ones.
